thread.title: POLL: More Than Half of Americans Want Congress to Investigate Contact Between Trump and Russia
thread.title_full: POLL: More Than Half of Americans Want Congress to Investigate Contact Between Trump and Russia

author: Justin Baragona
title: POLL: More Than Half of Americans Want Congress to Investigate Contact Between Trump and Russia
text:
POLL: More Than Half of Americans Want Congress to Investigate Contact Between Trump and Russia by Justin Baragona | 8:20   
According to a new NBC News/ Wall Street Journal poll , the majority of Americans would like to see Congress investigate if there was contact made between members of Donald Trump’s campaign and the Russian government. 
The poll shows 53% of the American adults feel Congress should look into alleged communications made by members of Trump’s camp with senior Russian intelligence officials. It was reported earlier this month that aides of Trump had contact with Russia during the election campaign. This was followed this week by reports that the White House tried to get the FBI to “knock down” those stories. 
Only 25% of respondents think Congress doesn’t need to probe these potential contacts and 21% don’t have an opinion. When broken down along partisan lines, only a quarter of Republicans want an investigation, compared to 55% of independents and 80% of Democrats. 
The poll also asked whether or not Congress should hold investigations into Russian interference in the presidential election. The intelligence community has already concluded that Russia did meddle in the election to assist Trump. 
The survey found 54% of the public wants to see an investigation into this matter, with 29% stating that it does not need to be looked at by Congress. Just as with the Russian contact probe, it was split along partisan lines, as only 25% of GOPers wanted to see an investigation. Meanwhile, 51% of independents and 84% of Democrats want to see a Congressional probe. 
[image via screengrab]
